channel.title: Aarch64.com - Blog
channel.description: Daily blog, run by experts, on the challenges of planning, coordinating and managing 50 units of Arm-based hardware in multiple, global locations.

item.title: Fosshost invited to The Business of Cloud Native podcast
item.description: On the 10th of February, our founder, Thomas Markey, [participated](https://www. emilyomier

item.title: Our name is changing!
item.description: We have decided to bring the Fosshost Project site in-line with other Arm-focussed open-source efforts, which is why with immediate effect, we've changed our name and domain before our first Arm-based compute platform goes live. We're working with Arm Limited and they gave us the domain aarch64

item.title: Featured Sponsor - Equinix Metal
item.description:
#### Welcome to our fourth post in a series of blog posts about our amazing sponsors
We are in the process of making some big changes, but today's blog post won't be about them. Instead, we will focus on one of our incredible [sponsors](https://arm-64

item.title: We'll be back in a moment
item.description: Apologies for our absence of blog posts. We've been busy planning, and working behind the scenes

item.title: Featured Sponsor - WebNX
item.description:
#### Welcome to our third post in a series of blog posts about our amazing sponsors
Today's featured [sponsor](https://arm-64. com/sponsors) is [WebNX](https://webnx

item.title: Beginning of talks with Arm Limited
item.description: In our endeavour to give an edge to the open-source community in the Arm world with the AArch64 project, we have gathered many sponsors, interest from projects and individuals, and volunteers. This is allowing us to advance our project and, hopefully soon, provide Arm-as-Service to the FOSS community

item.title: Thomas Markey gives interview with IMakeFOSS
item.description: #### Thomas Markey gives interview to IMakeFOSS, giving a voice to FOSS projects around the world. Every week we hand the mic to a new contributor

item.title: Featured Sponsor - CustodianDC
item.description:
#### Welcome to our second post in a series of blog posts about our incredible sponsors
Today, January 4th 2021, is an important day for many of you: the start of a new working year. Depending on your timezone, you may have either finished it or are only starting your day

item.title: Comments are live on Arm-64 blog posts
item.description: As we continue to write about our journey into the AArch64 world, we decided we wanted an easier way to get feedback from our readers. To that end, we now have a comments section in every blog post, so you can leave your feedback

item.title: Featured Sponsor - HiveDC
item.description:
#### Welcome to the first in a series of blog posts about our incredible sponsors
First and foremost, the Fosshost team wishes you a happy new year!
Our first featured [sponsor](https://arm-64. com/sponsors) is HiveDC, a Tier III+ colocation data center based in Montreal, Canada, and one of the leading choices for per unit and cabinet server colocation in the country

item.title: Infrastructure Overview
item.description: The network architecture planned for the Fosshost AArch64 deployment is a little different from a conventional "cloud" virtualization system: we have very little layer 3 infrastructure. Instead, the network relies on a large layer 2 domain
